channel.title: I need some help making a server status page
channel.description:
I did see the tutorial on how to make a server status pge but Its not what I am looking for.
I need help making one with Server name, server ip, server port, something that says if its online/offline, and its uptime percentage. So somthing like moparscape's. Can someone please help.
~M.dog311~

item.title: I need some help making a server status page
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Night26, post:17, topic:123610”][quote author=Ron link=topic=173400.msg1612431#msg1612431 date=1184873278]
You guys make things way too hard… Why not just use PHP?

Just use kilk’s code.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

It’s right there in the above mentioned topic link and it’s a simple PHP script. Why bother using cron and do all that work?
[/quote]

These are php files, cron is a batch program for linux, that runs command on a given interval. The reason cron is used so that things like uptime could be recorded, and the server status page loads in seconds, no matter how many servers you add onto it. THe current alternative you mentioned, keeps blogging down, and gets slower and slower for every server added. (The maximum runtime for a php script is 5 minutes, before apache times you out, this means my script can support 60 servers, at the same speed (Which is in seconds).

Yes kilos, I did code this myself, like 3 months ago, but stopped after finishing 90% of it.

m.dog, ill talk to you about it myself, because it looks like, php cant detect its own url from your server. (if so, try: changing line 80, and replace the action to the url of the script itself.

Kind of like

hope this helps.[/quote]

Ill try it. And knight, do you have MSN or something?

Read full topic

programming, irc, cars

It’s right there in the above mentioned topic link and it’s a simple PHP script. Why bother using cron and do all that work? :P[/quote]

These are php files, cron is a batch program for linux, that runs command on a given interval. The reason cron is used so that things like uptime could be recorded, and the server status page loads in seconds, no matter how many servers you add onto it. THe current alternative you mentioned, keeps blogging down, and gets slower and slower for every server added. (The maximum runtime for a php script is 5 minutes, before apache times you out, this means my script can support 60 servers, at the same speed (Which is in seconds).

Yes kilos, I did code this myself, like 3 months ago, but stopped after finishing 90% of it.

m.dog, ill talk to you about it myself, because it looks like, php cant detect its own url from your server. (if so, try: changing line 80, and replace the action to the url of the script itself.

Kind of like

hope this helps.

item.source: I need some help making a server status page

item.title: I need some help making a server status page
item.dc:creator: @Night26 Night26
item.description:
@Night26 wrote:

Main file: http://files-upload.com/383383/serverstatus.php.html (rename to index.php if needed be)
Serv spec file: http://files-upload.com/383384/servspec.php.html (tells details of the server)

http://files-upload.com/383388/rsservcron.php.html (you need a server that supports cron jobs!, set the cron to this script, for hourly or every 30 minutes or w.e., this updates the status of the servers)

database:

CREATE TABLE servs (
id int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
name varchar(100) NOT NULL,
ip varchar(100) NOT NULL,
port varchar(100) NOT NULL,
adv longtext NOT NULL,
url varchar(100) NOT NULL,
aim varchar(100) NOT NULL,
yahoo varchar(100) NOT NULL,
msn varchar(100) NOT NULL,
uptime varchar(100) NOT NULL,
dtime varchar(100) NOT NULL,
status tinyint(1) NOT NULL,
udate text NOT NULL,
PRIMARY KEY (id)
) TYPE=MyISAM AUTO_INCREMENT=3 ;

For all 3 files, you need to set the database access correctly.

Read full topic
